description: From Yiddish ישיבה‎ (yeshive), from Hebrew יְשִׁיבָה‎ (y'shivá, “meeting”).

entries.meaning: (Judaism) An academy for the advanced study of Jewish texts.
examples: Shalom grew up in an Orthodox family in Stamford Hill. His father, who ran an office-furniture business, intended him for a synagogue cantor, and when Shalom finished school he was sent to the yeshiva.
